means: [俚语]（尤指盗窃前）探察，侦查，窥测
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 凯斯职业名称，制箱人，来源于盎格鲁诺曼底法语，含义是“箱，盒”(case,container)
Centre for Advanced Studies in Environment <英>（建筑协会）环境高级研究中心

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"例子，事例"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: example, instance, case, sample, illustration, specimen
means: example ： 普通用词，指能代表同类事物性质或一般规律的典型例子。
instance ： 多指用于说明、支持或反证一般事实或理论的事例。
case ： 多指需要加以认真研究的实例，如病例，案例等。
illustration ： 指用来说明、解释某种理论或看法而引用的例证。
specimen可与sample换用，但常指人或物中选出的有代表性部分，或指供科研、化验或检验用的标本。

word_mean: 病案，病例，患者：某种疾病的一个特殊例子，例如白血病的病例
有时也被错误地用来指患病的病人
此词在牙科学中有时被错误地用来指型盒、假牙、铸造等

sentence.Network_en: He actually became convinced that the nurses had an unanswerable case.
sentence.Network_cn: 他实际上已经相信了护士们的情况确实如此。

sentence.Network_en: He put the case to the Saudi Foreign Minister.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把这起事件向沙特外长作了说明。

sentence.Network_en: The Government is anxious to keep the whole case out of court.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府迫切希望整件事能够在庭外解决。

jx.jx_en_mean: according to the circumstances (used when referring to two or more possible alternatives)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 看情形，根据情况（用于两种或多种可能选择中）

lj.lj_ly: the authorities will decide if they are satisfied or not satisfied, as the case may be.
lj.lj_ls: 当局会根据情况来决定他们是否满意。

jx.jx_en_mean: as a provision against something happening or being true

lj.lj_ly: we put on thick jumpers, in case it was cold.
lj.lj_ls: 我们穿上厚套衫以防天冷。

lj.lj_ly: in case you haven't figured it out, let me explain.
lj.lj_ls: 假如你还没弄明白，就让我来解释。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 在任何情况下决不，无论如何都不

jx.jx_en_mean: if that happens or has happened; if that is the situation
jx.jx_cn_mean: 既然那样，假若是那样的话

lj.lj_ly: ‘I'm free this evening.’ ‘In that case, why not have dinner with me?’.
lj.lj_ls: "今晚我有空。""既然这样，为什么不和我去吃晚餐？"。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)continually (or no longer) criticizing or harassing someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)不断（或不再）批评（或搅扰）某人

lj.lj_ly: teachers, you know, &B{get on your case}.
lj.lj_ls: 你知道，老师总是不断地批评你。

jx.jx_en_mean: Regardless of what has occurred or will occur.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 无论如何，总之：不管已经或将要发生什么

lj.lj_ly: took along an umbrella, just in case.
lj.lj_ls: 随身带一把伞，以防万一

jx.jx_en_mean: If there should happen to be

lj.lj_ly: a number to call in case of emergency.
lj.lj_ls: 万一发生意外打的号码

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French cas, from Latin casus 'fall', related to cadere 'to fall'; in sense 4 directly from Latin, translating Greek ptōsis, literally 'fall'
late Middle English: from Old French casse, chasse (modern caisse 'trunk, chest', châsse 'reliquary, frame'), from Latin capsa, related to capere 'to hold'

entry.def: A particular case is a particular situation or incident, especially one that you are using as an individual example or instance of something.

example.ex: Surgical training takes at least nine years, or 11 in the case of obstetrics...
example.tran: 外科至少需要9年的专业训练，产科甚至需要11年。

example.ex: One of the effects of dyslexia, in my case at least, is that you pay tremendous attention to detail...
example.tran: 诵读困难的一个影响就是过分注意细节，至少对我来说是如此。

entry.def: A case is a person or their particular problem that a doctor, social worker, or other professional is dealing with.

example.ex: ...the case of a 57-year-old man who had suffered a stroke...
example.tran: 一个患过中风的57岁男子的病例

example.ex: Some cases of arthritis respond to a gluten-free diet...
example.tran: 无麸质饮食对一些关节炎患者有疗效。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a sad case or a hopeless case, you mean that they are in a sad situation or a hopeless situation.

example.ex: I knew I was going to make it — that I wasn't a hopeless case.
example.tran: 我就知道自己能挺过去——我还没到山穷水尽的地步。

entry.def: A case is a crime or mystery that the police are investigating.

example.ex: The police have several suspects in the case of five murders committed in Gainesville, Florida...
example.tran: 警方就佛罗里达州盖恩斯维尔的5起谋杀案已经锁定了几名犯罪嫌疑人。

example.ex: Mr. Hitchens said you have solved some very unusual cases.
example.tran: 希钦斯先生说您破过一些非常离奇的案子。

entry.tran: (用以证明或反驳的)事实，根据，理由
entry.def: The case for or against a plan or idea consists of the facts and reasons used to support it or oppose it.

example.ex: He sat there while I made the case for his dismissal...
example.tran: 他坐在那儿，听我陈述解雇他的理由。

example.ex: Both these facts strengthen the case against hanging...
example.tran: 这两项事实使反对绞刑的理由更加充分。

entry.def: In law, a case is a trial or other legal inquiry.

example.ex: It can be difficult for public figures to win a libel case...
example.tran: 公众人物想打赢诽谤官司可能会很难。

example.ex: The case was brought by his family, who say their reputation has been damaged by allegations about him.
example.tran: 这起诉讼是他的家人提起的，他们称有关他的指控损害了他们的名誉。

entry.tran: （表示补充的内容比前述更重要，且支持或纠正前述）不管怎样，再者
entry.def: You say in any case when you are adding something which is more important than what you have just said, but which supports or corrects it.

example.ex: The concert was booked out, and in any case, most of the people gathered in the square could not afford the price of a ticket.
example.tran: 音乐会门票已经预订一空，再者，聚在广场上的人多数也买不起票。

entry.tran: （强调后面的陈述至关重要或十分肯定）不管怎样，无论如何
entry.def: You say in any case after talking about things that you are not sure about, to emphasize that your next statement is the most important thing or the thing that you are sure about.

example.ex: Either he escaped, or he came to grief. In any case, he was never seen again.
example.tran: 他要么逃掉了，要么遭到了不测。不管怎么样，反正再也没有人见过他。

entry.def: If you do something in case or just in case a particular thing happens, you do it because that thing might happen.

example.ex: In case anyone was following me, I made an elaborate detour...
example.tran: 为了防止有人跟踪我，我特地绕了弯路。

example.ex: Extra boiling water should be kept at hand just in case it is needed.
example.tran: 身边应多准备一些开水，以备不时之需。

entry.def: If you do something or have something in case of a particular thing, you do it or have it because that thing might happen or be true.

example.ex: Many shops along the route have been boarded up in case of trouble.
example.tran: 沿途很多商店的门窗都用木板封上了，以防不测。

entry.tran: (表示不耐烦地陈述显而易见或与听话人无关的事情)竟然，难道，假使
entry.def: You use in case in expressions like 'in case you didn't know' or 'in case you've forgotten' when you are telling someone in a rather irritated way something that you think is either obvious or none of their business.

example.ex: She's nervous about something, in case you didn't notice...
example.tran: 她正为了什么事神经紧张，你连这个都没看出来？

example.ex: 'I'm waiting for Mary Ann,' she said, 'in case you're wondering.'
example.tran: “我在等玛丽·安，”她说，“要是你想知道的话。”

entry.tran: 那样的话;在那种情况下
entry.def: You say in that case or in which case to indicate that what you are going to say is true if the possible situation that has just been mentioned actually exists.

example.ex: Perhaps you've some doubts about the attack. In that case it may interest you to know that Miss Woods witnessed it...
example.tran: 你也许对这起袭击还有些怀疑。那么如果我告诉你伍兹小姐亲眼目睹了这起事件，你可能会感兴趣。

example.ex: Members are concerned that a merger might mean higher costs, in which case they would oppose it.
example.tran: 成员们担心合并会导致成本提高，若是那样的话，他们将提出反对。

entry.def: You can say that you are doing something just in case to refer vaguely to the possibility that a thing might happen or be true, without saying exactly what it is.

example.ex: I guess we've already talked about this but I'll ask you again just in case.
example.tran: 我想我们已经谈过这个问题了，不过为了以防万一，我再问你一次。

entry.tran: 无论情况如何；无论怎样
entry.def: You say as the case may be or whatever the case may be to indicate that the statement you are making applies equally to the two or more alternatives that you have mentioned.

example.ex: They know how everything works — or doesn't work, as the case may be.
example.tran: 他们了解一切是如何运作的，或者为何出差错，无论是哪种情况，他们都很清楚。

entry.def: If you say that a task or situation is a case of a particular thing, you mean that it consists of that thing or can be described as that thing.

example.ex: It's a case of relaxing, then playing...
example.tran: 应该是先放松，然后再玩。

example.ex: It's not a case of whether anyone would notice or not.
example.tran: 这不是会不会有人注意到的问题。

entry.tran: 典型的例子;恰当的例证
entry.def: If you say that something is a case in point, you mean that it is a good example of something you have just mentioned.

example.ex: In many cases religious persecution is the cause of people fleeing their country. A case in point is colonial India.
example.tran: 很多情况下，宗教迫害是导致人们逃奔异国他乡的原因。一个典型的例子是殖民统治时期的印度。

entry.def: If you say that something is the case, you mean that it is true or correct.

example.ex: You'll probably notice her having difficulty swallowing. If this is the case, give her plenty of liquids...
example.tran: 你可能会注意到她吞咽有困难。要是这样的话，让她多吃流食。

example.ex: Consumers had hoped the higher prices would mean more goods in stores. But that was not the case.
example.tran: 消费者本来以为，物价上涨了，店里的商品会增多;但是情况并非如此。

entry.def: If you say that someone is on the case, you mean that they are aware of a particular problem and are trying to resolve it.

example.ex: The CompuServe management is on the case now, and it looks as if things will return to normal soon.
example.tran: CompuServe在线服务公司的管理层正在处理这个问题，看样子，要不了多久，一切就能恢复正常。

entry.def: A case is a container that is specially designed to hold or protect something.

example.ex: ...a black case for his spectacles.
example.tran: 他的黑色眼镜盒

example.ex: ...a 10-foot-long stuffed alligator in a glass case.
example.tran: 陈放在玻璃柜里、长10英尺的短吻鳄标本

entry.def: A case is a suitcase.
A case of wine or other alcoholic drink is a box containing a number of bottles, usually twelve, which is sold as a single unit.

example.ex: ...a case of champagne.
example.tran: 一箱香槟酒

entry.def: In the grammar of many languages, the case of a group such as a noun group or adjective group is the form it has which shows its relationship to other groups in the sentence.

means.word_mean: 1. a comprehensive term for any proceeding in a court of law whereby an individual seeks a legal remedy;

sentences.sentence: "the family brought suit against the landlord"

means.word_mean: 2. an occurrence of something;

sentences.sentence: "it was a case of bad judgment"
"another instance occurred yesterday"
"but there is always the famous example of the Smiths"

means.word_mean: 3. a special set of circumstances;

sentences.sentence: "in that event, the first possibility is excluded"
"it may rain in which case the picnic will be canceled"

means.word_mean: 4. a problem requiring investigation;

sentences.sentence: "Perry Mason solved the case of the missing heir"

means.word_mean: 5. the actual state of things;

sentences.sentence: "that was not the case"

means.word_mean: 6. a statement of facts and reasons used to support an argument;

sentences.sentence: "he stated his case clearly"

means.word_mean: 7. a portable container for carrying several objects;

sentences.sentence: "the musicians left their instrument cases backstage"

means.word_mean: 8. a person who is subjected to experimental or other observational procedures; someone who is an object of investigation;

sentences.sentence: "the subjects for this investigation were selected randomly"
"the cases that we studied were drawn from two different communities"

means.word_mean: 9. a person requiring professional services;

sentences.sentence: "a typical case was the suburban housewife described by a marriage counselor"

means.word_mean: 10. the quantity contained in a case
11. a glass container used to store and display items in a shop or museum or home
12. a specific state of mind that is temporary;

sentences.sentence: "a case of the jitters"

means.word_mean: 13. nouns or pronouns or adjectives (often marked by inflection) related in some way to other words in a sentence
14. the housing or outer covering of something;

sentences.sentence: "the clock has a walnut case"

means.word_mean: 15. a person of a specified kind (usually with many eccentricities);

sentences.sentence: "a real character"
"a strange character"
"a friendly eccentric"
"the capable type"
"a mental case"

means.word_mean: 16. an enveloping structure or covering enclosing an animal or plant organ or part
17. the enclosing frame around a door or window opening;

sentences.sentence: "the casings had rotted away and had to be replaced"

means.word_mean: 18. bed linen consisting of a cover for a pillow;

sentences.sentence: "the burglar carried his loot in a pillowcase"

means.word_mean: 1. look over, usually with the intention to rob;

sentences.sentence: "They men cased the housed"

means.word_mean: 2. enclose in, or as if in, a case;

sentences.sentence: "my feet were encased in mud"

example.en: He carried a case on $1,000 bail.
example.zh: 他交保1,000美元后在外候审。

list.explanation: [军队用语]最坏的设想，未来的最糟结果或出路

example.en: In the worst-case scenario, we're all dead.
example.zh: 那最坏的设想是我们大家全部死光。

auth_sentence.content: In that case, who are Firmus and Spectatus?
auth_sentence.res_content: In that case, who are Firmus and Spectatus?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In that case, who are Firmus and Spectatus?

auth_sentence.content: Take the specific case of Jesus and King David.
auth_sentence.res_content: Take the specific case of Jesus and King David.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Take the specific case of Jesus and King David.

auth_sentence.content: In this case, probably more supply than demand.
auth_sentence.res_content: In this case, probably more supply than demand.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In this case, probably more supply than demand.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =fall,表示"落下,降临"; 2. 引申为偶然发生

stems_affixes.word_buile: cas落下,降临+ual……的→落下的→不是安排好的→偶然的
cas落下+cad落下+e→落下再落下→瀑布

stems_affixes.value_cn: 事, 病例, 案例, 情形, 场合
stems_affixes.word_buile: cas落下,降临+e→[某事]降临,发生→事, 病例, 案例, 情形, 场合
casual偶然的+ty表名词→[突然]落下的事→事故
oc使+cas落下+ion表名词→使……落下→事情发生
cash=case装,容器→装在[钱包]里面的→现金
cash[n.现金 v.兑现]+ier人→管钱的人
case[n.容器]+ette小的东西→n.盒子, 盒式磁带
cash=case装,容器→装在[钱包]里面的→现金

Sentence.sentence: His doctors were puzzled by the strange case of permanent sleeplessness.
What do doctors think of Al Herpin's case

The authors documented an annual drop of as many as 120,000 cases of heart disease, 66,000 instances of stroke and 99,000 heart attacks caused by high blood pressure after a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt.

means.word_mean: 事例, 实例

sentences.en: Could you give us a concrete case?
sentences.cn: 你能不能给我们举个具体事例?

means.word_mean: 实情, 情况

sentences.en: Actually, it is not the case.
sentences.cn: 实际上, 情况不是这样的。

means.word_mean: 病例, 病症, 患者

sentences.en: Cases of smallpox are becoming rare.

means.word_mean: 把…装入箱(或盒等)内

sentences.en: All the books have been cased for shipping.
sentences.cn: 所有书籍已经装箱待运。

means.word_mean: 加盖于；包围，围住

sentences.en: The lower story of the building was cased with marble.
sentences.cn: 大楼底层的外墙砌上了一层大理石。

means.word_mean: [俚语](尤指盗窃前)探察，侦查，窥测

sentences.en: The bank was carefully cased by the bandits before the robbery.
sentences.cn: 银行在抢劫案发生之前曾被匪徒彻底勘查过。

jushi.english: Case is an important part of the grammar of many languages.
jushi.chinese: 格在很多语言的语法里都很重要。

jushi.english: Is there evidence to support his case?
jushi.chinese: 有证据作为他诉讼的依据吗?

jushi.english: That's often the case with him.
jushi.chinese: 他这人往往就是那样的。
